AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

beamTokens(address[],address[],uint16[],.details: Multi-transfer tokens and NFTs to a single or many recipients.

params.ids: Identifier numbers of tokens (ERC-721 and -1155 only).
params.to: Addresses of token recipients. Must have a length of 1 or `tokens.length`.
params.tokens: Contract addresses of tokens (use 0x0 for native transfers).

disableUpgrades().details: Permanently disables upgrades for the contract. Owner only.

getApprovals(address,address,address[],u.details: Checks approval state for tokens for the given `operator` address. This is a gas-intensive convenience method that is meant to be consumed by applications, and should preferably not be called from a smart contract directly.

params.ids: Identifier of tokens. Only used for ERC721, can be left empty otherwise.
params.types: Types of tokens (supported: 20|721|1155). Only used for ERC20, can be left empty otherwise.
params.values: Quantities of approved tokens. Only used for ERC20, can be left empty otherwise.

returns._0: approvalStates Array of booleans to indicate whether `owner`'s `token` is approved for `operator`.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

recoverFunds(address,address,uint16,uint.details: Recovers funds stuck in the contract. Owner only.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setTipRecipient(address).details: Sets a new recipient for protocol tips. Owner only.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradesDisabled().details: Returns the upgradeability state of the contract.

getApprovals(address,address,address[],u.notice: Default behaviour for empty types, ids and values parameters: Types (0 = native, 20 = ERC-20, 721 = ERC-721, 1155 = ERC-1155): - If types are provided, the contract uses them to check the approval state. - If types are not provided, the contract checks if ids are provided to defaut to ERC-721, then   checks for values to default to ERC-20, and if not, defaults to ERC-1155. Ids (only used for ERC-721): - If ids are provided, the contract uses them to check the approval state of corresponding ERC-721 id. - If ids are not provided, the contract defaults to ERC-721. Values (only used for ERC-20): - If values are provided, the contract uses them to check the approval amount of ERC-20. - If values are not provided, the contract defaults the value to 1.

userdoc.notice: A smart contract to facilitate batch token transfers (native, ERC-20, -721, -1155) and -approval checks.
